@saiarcot895  @yxieca could you please help to merge?

Need to add a test to cover:
```
if entry['protocol'] in ('connected', 'kernel'):
    continue
```

Seems route check tests weren't even running due to wrong numbering of the test cases since the merge of the feature. Looking at the history, it seems that two PRs added test case with the same number leading to no merge conflict, but no hiding another one.
This desing should be reconcidered as it is very easy to make mistake that is unnoticable.
The coverage passes now, @prsunny @lolyu please re-review.

Hi @abdosi , need help to prioritize this double commit for 202305. Thanks

hi @abdosi  could we have ADO if you support this chery pick?

@StormLiangMS  Updated.

Sorry I missed this review.
Can you please confirm if the change only applies to the scenario when installing SONiC from ONiE?

> Sorry I missed this review. Can you please confirm if the change only applies to the scenario when installing SONiC from ONiE?

Hi
It is applied whenever the buffer configuration is empty. In most cases, it should be the case that the device is installed from ONIE.
In case a user removes all the buffer/QoS configurations and then saves the configuration, and then executes `config reload` it should also be applied.

> > Sorry I missed this review. Can you please confirm if the change only applies to the scenario when installing SONiC from ONiE?
> 
> Hi It is applied whenever the buffer configuration is empty. In most cases, it should be the case that the device is installed from ONIE. In case a user removes all the buffer/QoS configurations and then saves the configuration, and then executes `config reload` it should also be applied.

Is this change required for other release branch?

> > > Sorry I missed this review. Can you please confirm if the change only applies to the scenario when installing SONiC from ONiE?
> > 
> > 
> > Hi It is applied whenever the buffer configuration is empty. In most cases, it should be the case that the device is installed from ONIE. In case a user removes all the buffer/QoS configurations and then saves the configuration, and then executes `config reload` it should also be applied.
> 
> Is this change required for other release branch?

Yes. We suggest cherry-picking it to 202311. Tag added.
